title: Put on your climbing shoes & trek to Kunti Betta in Karnataka or Tapalwadi in Maharashtra
text:
ET-Travel suggests you take a casual day off at work to make the most of an extended weekend in coming months. Here's where you can head to...
Upcoming holidays in Oct 2015 
- Friday, Oct 2, 2015 — Gandhi Jayanti
- Thursday, Oct 22, 2015 — Dassehra
From Mumbai: Tapalwadi Near Neral, Maharashtra 
ET-Travel reader Shezad Mansuri got his friends together and trekked to a place near Neral. He says: We came to know about a place called Tapalwadi, which is a small village and is popular for attracting tourists due to a waterfall nearby. The falls here are not so high but the volume of water flowing is immense. It's beautiful and safe.

The area is full of lush greenery, which makes it a destination away from the noisy daily commute.
Apart from rafting, rock climbing and rappelling, we found many other smaller waterfalls hidden in Tapalwadi forest area. It was good fun with friends.
The trek to the waterfall is moderate. The effort pays off as the natural beauty, gurgling sound of flowing water and cool breeze comes as a welcome change. We too were gently energised and kept trekking ahead.
We sat around the shade of tall trees and had a small picnic, taking group pictures and enjoyed our conversations.
From Delhi: Solan, Himachal Pradesh 
Picturesque town of Solan is the largest Municipal Council of Himachal Pradesh , which is located about 46 kilometres south of the state capital, Shimla. This town finds its name inspired by Goddess Shoolini Devi. Every year in the month of June, a fair celebrating the goddess is held, featuring a 3-day mela at the central Thoudo grounds. Solan was the capital of the erstwhile princely state, Bhagat.

Vegetation of Solan is particularly of high standard. Mushrooms and tomatoes are grown in plenty and sent to other markets. Interestingly, it is known as the 'Mushroom city of India' due to the vast mushroom farming in the area. The town is situated between Chandigarh (joint capital of Punjab and Haryana) and Shimla (state capital), on the Kalka-Shimla National Highway-22. The Kalka-Shimla narrow gauge heritage railway line, built by the British passes through Solan.
Cuisine & shopping: Himachalis have delicious cuisine and love to host guests. You may find it a little spicy though. Do try Poode and Pachole. Shopping for local handmade decorative items can be done in street boutiques and malls.
From Bangalore: Kunti Betta Trek, Karnataka 
Families who like to offer an outdoorsy holiday to their kids can now find some good news in Kunti Betta. It is a picturesque hill in the quaint town of Padavapura , marked by the two hills at an elevation of 2,882m, the Kunti Betta trek has to be a 'must-try' on a trekker's itinerary. Situated in the ancient town, Kunti Betta is famous all over Karnataka for its relatively easy elevations and beautiful pathways. So beautiful is this trail that mythology states that the Pandavas stayed here during their exile and their mother Kunti, made it one of her favoured places.

Beginning from Bangalore, a drive will take you to Kunti Betta in around 4 hours. The Kunti Betta trail includes steep ascents and descents. You will witness the Thonnur Lake nearby during your trek. The view around is gorgeous at this time of year as surrounding fields and hillocks offer great scenery for your photography passion. Interestingly, a night trek is also offered by leading tour agencies here. If on a night trek, there are spots sheltered from the high winds by boulders that are great for lighting a campfire. Kunti Betta also offers rappelling and water sport activities to pump up your excitement levels.
